018package com.scivicslab.actoriac.accumulator;
019
020import java.time.LocalDateTime;
021import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
022import java.util.logging.Handler;
023import java.util.logging.LogRecord;
024
025import org.json.JSONObject;
026
027import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorRef;
028import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorSystem;
029
030/**
031 * A java.util.logging Handler that forwards log messages to MultiplexerAccumulatorIIAR.
032 *
033 * <p>This handler bridges java.util.logging with the MultiplexerAccumulator system,
034 * allowing all log messages to be captured in the same output destinations
035 * (console, file, database) as command output and cowsay.</p>
036 *
037 * <h2>Log Format</h2>
038 * <p>Log messages are formatted as:</p>
039 * <pre>{@code
040 * 2026-01-17 12:27:54 INFO Starting workflow: main-collect-sysinfo
041 * }</pre>
042 *
043 * <h2>Message Format</h2>
044 * <p>Messages sent to MultiplexerAccumulator:</p>
045 * <pre>{@code
046 * {
047 *   "source": "cli",
048 *   "type": "log-INFO",
049 *   "data": "2026-01-17 12:27:54 INFO Starting workflow: main-collect-sysinfo"
050 * }
051 * }</pre>
052 *
053 * <h2>Usage</h2>
054 * <pre>{@code
055 * // After registering MultiplexerAccumulatorIIAR
056 * MultiplexerLogHandler logHandler = new MultiplexerLogHandler(system);
057 * Logger.getLogger("").addHandler(logHandler);
058 * }</pre>
059 *
060 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
061 * @since 2.12.0
062 */
063public class MultiplexerLogHandler extends Handler {
064
065    private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMATTER =
066        DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss");
067
068    private final IIActorSystem system;
069    private volatile boolean closed = false;
070
071    /**
072     * Constructs a MultiplexerLogHandler.
073     *
074     * @param system the actor system to retrieve outputMultiplexer from
075     */
076    public MultiplexerLogHandler(IIActorSystem system) {
077        this.system = system;
078    }
079
080    @Override
081    public void publish(LogRecord record) {
082        if (closed || record == null) {
083            return;
084        }
085
086        // Skip if log level is not loggable
087        if (!isLoggable(record)) {
088            return;
089        }
090
091        // Get the multiplexer actor (lazy lookup for loose coupling)
092        IIActorRef<?> multiplexer = system.getIIActor("outputMultiplexer");
093        if (multiplexer == null) {
094            // Multiplexer not yet registered, skip
095            return;
096        }
097
098        // Format the log message
099        String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().format(FORMATTER);
100        String level = record.getLevel().getName();
101        String message = formatMessage(record);
102        String formattedLog = String.format("%s %s %s", timestamp, level, message);
103
104        // Send to multiplexer
105        try {
106            JSONObject arg = new JSONObject();
107            arg.put("source", getSourceName(record));
108            arg.put("type", "log-" + level);
109            arg.put("data", formattedLog);
110            multiplexer.callByActionName("add", arg.toString());
111        } catch (Exception e) {
112            // Avoid infinite recursion - don't log errors from the log handler
113            System.err.println("MultiplexerLogHandler error: " + e.getMessage());
114        }
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Formats the log message, including any throwable if present.
119     */
120    private String formatMessage(LogRecord record) {
121        String message = record.getMessage();
122
123        // Handle parameterized messages
124        Object[] params = record.getParameters();
125        if (params != null && params.length > 0) {
126            try {
127                message = String.format(message, params);
128            } catch (Exception e) {
129                // If formatting fails, use the raw message
130            }
131        }
132
133        // Append throwable if present
134        Throwable thrown = record.getThrown();
135        if (thrown != null) {
136            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message);
137            sb.append("\n").append(thrown.getClass().getName());
138            if (thrown.getMessage() != null) {
139                sb.append(": ").append(thrown.getMessage());
140            }
141            for (StackTraceElement element : thrown.getStackTrace()) {
142                sb.append("\n\tat ").append(element);
143            }
144            message = sb.toString();
145        }
146
147        return message;
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * Determines the source name from the log record.
152     */
153    private String getSourceName(LogRecord record) {
154        String loggerName = record.getLoggerName();
155        if (loggerName == null || loggerName.isEmpty()) {
156            return "system";
157        }
158
159        // Use short name for common patterns
160        if (loggerName.startsWith("com.scivicslab.actoriac.cli")) {
161            return "cli";
162        }
163        if (loggerName.startsWith("com.scivicslab.actoriac")) {
164            return "actor-iac";
165        }
166        if (loggerName.startsWith("com.scivicslab.pojoactor")) {
167            return "pojo-actor";
168        }
169
170        // Return the last part of the logger name
171        int lastDot = loggerName.lastIndexOf('.');
172        if (lastDot >= 0 && lastDot < loggerName.length() - 1) {
173            return loggerName.substring(lastDot + 1);
174        }
175
176        return loggerName;
177    }
178
179    @Override
180    public void flush() {
181        // No buffering, nothing to flush
182    }
183
184    @Override
185    public void close() throws SecurityException {
186        closed = true;
187    }
188}
